text: long topic, and not an API topic

there is an audit log recently dev'ed but it doesn't have an API

there are APIs that can pae through objects by age and last updated time and object property change history

there are webhooks to register for changes

we need way more detail about the use case to really comment
nobody is tossing out older version APIs
they are slowly working on standardizing and cleaning up to V3
don't panic and just use what works, but keep in mind some months or couple years in the future it might need a bit of code update

Okay, got it - having the idProperty undefined breaks it for some reason
It is there in the example on the api docs
I just removed it from the api call
`const apiResponse = await HubSpotClient.crm.contacts.basicApi.update(_id_, simplePublicObjectInput);` in case anyone else runs into this

Hi!

Thank you for answering. So there's no way to know if the user is on EU GDPR territorial HS instance, in order to provide a proper URL? :thinking_face:
i believe this is resolved.  <@U02AV82QPRS> yell if otherwise

<@UD53A9UUR> yes, the solution ended up being that some unrelated fields were marked as :warning: far down in our field mappings. By removing the :warning: fields and saving, it allow everything to start syncing again.

If I may make a recommendation, we would have been much preferred (and it would make it easier to find) if only the :warning:  fields stopped syncing but all of the properly mapped fields kept syncing
glad it is resolved.  that is good feedback!

<@U021JKWA1GB>, Matthew’s point was kind of my question. I had no tech issues, I was just wondering why an endpoint such as form submission wasn’t in the newer docs with the newer standards. THANKS A LOT Y’ALL!
